div1.head: Military Orders for John S. Neate, July 1, 1900
div1.p:
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES Vol 175 A 1900
H. K.
Adjutant General
OFFICE,
JUL 16 1900
DIVISION

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, July 1, 1900.

1. Leave of absence for one (1) month, with permission
to apply for an extension of one (1) month, and to go be-
yond the limits of the Division, is hereby granted to Major
Thaddeus P. Varney, Additional Paymaster, U. S. Volun-
teers.

2. Leave of absence for two (2) months, with permission
to go beyond the limits of the Division, is hereby granted
to Major William H. Miller, Quartermaster, U. S. Volun-
teers, Chief Quartermaster, Department of Matanzas and
Santa Clara.

3. Acting Assistant Surgeon Pemberton Lundy, U. S.
Army, is hereby relieved from duty in the Division, and
will proceed to Buffalo, New York, the place at which he
entered into contract, and upon arrival thereat, report by
letter to the Surgeon General of the Army, for annulment
of the same.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

4. Lieutenant J. T. Sayles, Signal Officer, U. S. Volun-
teers, will proceed to Matanzas, Cuba, reporting upon ar-
rival to the Commanding General, Department of Matanzas
and Santa Clara, for temporary duty as signal officer dur-
ing the absence of Lieutenant Charles B. Rogan, Signal Offi-
cer, U. S. Volunteers.

Lieutenant Rogan will transfer all public property for
which he is responsible to Lieutenant Sayles, taking receipts
therefor, and also submit to the Auditor of the Island an
accounting of all public funds for which he may be respon-
sible before taking advantage of the leave granted him in
paragraph 3, Special Orders No. 100, current series, these
headquarters.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

5. Upon the request of the president of the board of
medical officers convened by paragraph 34, Special Orders
No. 122, current series, Headquarters of the Army, Hospi-
tal Steward John S. Neate, U. S. Army, now on duty with
said board, is assigned to station in the city of Havana.

The Quartermaster's Department will provide him with
suitable quarters at a rental not exceeding twelve ($12.00)
dollars per month, and the Subsistence Department will
commute his rations under A. R. 1272, at the rate of
seventy-five (75) cents per day, while engaged in the per-
formance of such duty, it being impracticable to provide
for his subsistence in any other way.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
